meanings.definition: A place where aircraft are parked.
meanings.sent1: The airparks at the airport were filled with planes of all sizes.
meanings.sent2: We visited the airparks to see the different types of aircraft up close.
meanings.sent3: The airparks looked like a giant parking lot for airplanes!
meanings.sent4: The rows of aircraft in the airparks resembled neatly parked cars in a lot.
meanings.sent5: The sun glinted off the metal bodies of the planes in the airparks.

meanings.definition: To park aircraft in a designated area.
meanings.sent1: The pilots carefully airparks their planes after landing.
meanings.sent2: It is important to airparks the aircraft in the correct spot to avoid congestion.
meanings.sent3: The birds watched in amazement as the pilots airparks the planes with precision.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully airparks the helicopter as if it were a toy in her hands.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic taught the new pilot how to airparks the plane safely.

meanings.definition: The act of parking aircraft in a specific location.
meanings.sent1: The airparks of the military base were always busy with incoming and outgoing flights.
meanings.sent2: His job involved overseeing the airparks to ensure all planes were parked correctly.
meanings.sent3: The airparks competition at the airshow was a fun event for aviation enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The precision required in the airparks of commercial airlines is impressive.
meanings.sent5: The airparks operation ran smoothly thanks to the experienced ground crew.
